alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Powell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 06 at 8:44PM EDT until August 06 at 10:30PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY AND NORTHWESTERN POWELL COUNTIES... At 844 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms had moved out of the warned area; however excessive runoff from previous heavy rainfall will continue to cause isolated flash flooding in low lying areas. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Stanton, Jeffersonville, Clay City, Waltersville, Bean, Powell Valley, Virden, Rosslyn, Westbend and Cat Creek. This includes the following streams and drainages... Lower Cane Creek, Hog Creek, Morris Creek, Red River, Lulbegrud Creek, Brush Creek, Hardwick Creek, Cane Creek, Martin Fork, South Fork Upper Spruce Creek, Camp Branch, North Branch Lulbegrud Creek, Black Creek, Slate Creek, Ficklin Fork, Cooperas Creek, Paint Creek, Plum Branch, Hatcher Creek, Bowling Fork, Spruce Creek, Middle Fork Right Fork Cane Creek and Judy Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
